intro: Hieracium oporinoides, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is characterized by its bright yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, often forming dense colonies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and sometimes reddish in color. Hieracium oporinoides is an annual or biennial plant that plays a role in pollination and soil stabilization in its native habitats.
